00044 struct Vector2
00045 {
00046 public:
00047         //x-axis value
00048         float x;
00049         //z-axis value
00050         float z;
00051 
00058         Vector2(float x, float z) {
00059                 Vector2::x = x;
00060                 Vector2::z = z;
00061         };
00062 
00067         Vector2() { x = 0; z = 0; };
00068 
00073         Vector2(float num) {
00074                 x = num;
00075                 z = num;
00076         }
00077 
00083         Vector2 operator = (const Vector2 original) {
00084                 x = original.x;
00085                 z = original.z;
00086                 return Vector2(x, z);
00087         };
00088 
00095         static float Dot(Vector2 one, Vector2 two) {
00096                 return one.x*two.x + one.z *two.z;
00097         }
00098 
00104         friend std::ostream & operator <<(std::ostream & os, const Vector2 & vector) {
00105                 os << vector.x << "  " << vector.z;
00106                 return os;
00107         }

00116         static Vector2 Normal(Vector2 a, Vector2 b, Vector2 c) {
00117                 return Cross(a - b, c - b);
00118         }
00119 
00126         static Vector2 Cross(const Vector2 first, const Vector2 second) {
00127                 return Vector2(first.x * second.z + first.z * second.x);
00128         }
00129 
00136         static float Distance(const Vector2 first, const Vector2 second) {
00137                 return sqrt((second.x - first.x)*(second.x - first.x) +
00138                         (second.z - first.z)*(second.z - first.z));
00139         }
00140 
00141         /*
00142         * @brief Multiplies this vector by the parameter.
00143         * @param the scalar
00144         * @return the result of multiplication.
00145         */
00146         Vector2 operator * (const float scalar) {
00147                 x *= scalar;
00148                 z *= scalar;
00149                 return Vector2(x, z);
00150         };
00151 
00152         /*
00153         * @brief Adds two vectors together.
00154         * @param second - a vector which has to be added
00155         * @return the result of addition.
00156         */
00157         Vector2 operator + (const Vector2 second) {
00158                 this->x += second.x;
00159                 this->z += second.z;
00160                 return *this;
00161         }
00162 
00163         /*
00164         * @brief Subtracts the parameter from this vector.
00165         * @param second - a vector which has to be subtracted from this vector.
00166         * @return the result of subtraction.
00167         */
00168         Vector2 operator - (const Vector2 second) {
00169                 this->x -= second.x;
00170                 this->z -= second.z;
00171                 return *this;
00172         }
00173 
00179         float operator[](const int index)  const {
00180                 if (index == 0)
00181                         return x;
00182                 else if (index == 1)
00183                         return z;
00184                 else
00185                         return -10000000;
00186         }
00187 
00193         void Set(int index, float value) {
00194                 if (index == 0)
00195                         x = value;
00196                 else if (index == 1)
00197                         z = value;
00198         }

00206         Vector2 operator / (const float copy) {
00207                 x /= copy;
00208                 z /= copy;
00209                 return Vector2(x, z);
00210         }
00211 
00212         /*
00213         * @brief Calculates the length of this vector.
00214         * @return the length of the vector.
00215         */
00216         float Length() {
00217                 return sqrt((x*x) + (z*z));
00218         }

00224         Vector2 Normalized() const {
00225                 float length = Vector2(x, z).Length();
00226                 if (length == 0)
00227                         return Vector2(0);
00228                 else {
00229                         return Vector2(x / length, z / length);
00230                 }
00231         }
